item.title: Ethernet over Copper Is The New Telephone Line
item.description:
For over a century, twisted pair copper wiring has been the standard for telephone service, and remarkably, it remains a leading technology today. However, this isn’t a simple case of “what’s old is new again.” While the copper wires themselves are familiar, the technology now utilizes digital signals instead of the analog signals of the past. You might wonder why copper is still relevant in the age of fiber optics. The answer is cost-effectiveness...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ethernet-over-copper-is-the-new-telephone-line/
